step1.sentence: I signed up for a free trial of the streaming service to see if I liked it.

step2.story: Mia had been meaning to take a yoga class for months. When she finally saw a flyer at the community center, she signed up right away. She felt proud of herself for taking the first step.

step3.story: Jake had always wanted to learn how to cook properly, but he kept putting it off. One evening, his coworker mentioned a weekend cooking workshop downtown. That night, Jake went online and signed up before he could change his mind. The class was small, just eight people gathered around a kitchen island. By the end of the session, he had made a full three-course meal from scratch. He couldn't believe he had waited so long to sign up for something that brought him so much joy.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 서명(sign)을 해서 위로(up) 올린다는 뜻으로, 명부에 이름을 올리는 행위를 나타냅니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 서비스, 수업, 행사 등에 등록하거나 가입할 때 사용합니다. 온라인 계정을 만들 때도 'sign up'을 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 과거 군대나 단체에 입대·입회할 때 문서에 서명(sign)하던 관습에서 유래했습니다. 'up'은 목록에 이름이 추가되는 느낌을 더합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 자발적으로 참여하거나 등록하는 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 'register'보다 캐주얼하고 일상적인 느낌이며, 특히 구어체에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Have you signed up for the newsletter yet?
